column1: Orofarnë was one of the rowans of Fangorn Forest
column2: much beloved by the Ents Quickbeam. It was cut down by Orcs of Isengard
column3: arousing the anger of this impulsive Ent.

column2: J.R.R. Tolkien explained that orofarne means "mountain-dwelling" in High-elven (Quenya). In another manuscript he glossed Orofarnë as "mountain ash"
column3: consisting of the Quenya elements Oron#Quenya ("hill") + farnë?/pharne ("any growing thing or plant").

column1: Editors Carl F. Hostetter and Patrick H. Wynne have made a connection between the Qenya word farne ("foliage"; a derivative of the Sundocarme PHAS-
column2: also appearing under the rejected Sundocarme PHARAN-) and the name Orofarnë.
